page.title: 15FARMING SUTTON BONINGTON
page.content: {Tom Shepherd}the{farmer}moved his{farm from Park Lane to Hungary Lane. He decided to do this because being based in the village caused many difficulties. Some of his land had been sold off to builders and the school which meant there were { complaints about smell and noise. He had poor access to the{fields}and it was impossible to leave the yard from 08.30_09.15. Moving to another site had several advantages. He was able to expand and had more room for turning {tractors.}The site was much bigger so it could be used for mechanical {farming}and he only had to employ 3 men instead of 9.{Mr Shepherd}is mainly an arable{farmer}and owns all the equipment needed. His 400 acre {farm}is of average size.Today an acre costs Â£2000 and{Mr Shepherd's farm belonging to{Miss Paget}is worth Â£1m.
